hints.label: thm-hypoellipticity-cinf
hints.title: Hypoellipticity via Hörmander's Criterion
hints.content:
870: :label: thm-hypoellipticity-cinf
871: 
872: The adaptive Langevin generator L (Definition {prf:ref}`def-adaptive-generator-cinf`) is **hypoelliptic**: for all t > 0, the transition density p_t(w, w') is C∞ in both arguments.
873: 
874: **Hörmander's condition**: L = ∑_i Y_i² + Y_0 where:
875: - Y_i = ∂_{v_i} (thermal noise directions)
876: - Y_0 = v · ∇_x - (∇V_total + γv) · ∇_v (drift)
877: 
878: The Lie bracket [Y_0, Y_i] = ∂_{x_i} (position derivative) is independent of thermal noise. The Lie algebra spans the full tangent space T(X × ℝ^d), satisfying Hörmander's bracket condition.
879: 
880: **Conclusion**: By Hörmander's theorem (Hörmander, Acta Math. 1967), L is hypoelliptic, and p_t(w, w') ∈ C∞ for t > 0.

876: - Y_0 = v · ∇_x - (∇V_total + γv) · ∇_v (drift)

878: The Lie bracket [Y_0, Y_i] = ∂_{x_i} (position derivative) is independent of thermal noise. The Lie algebra spans the full tangent space T(X × ℝ^d), satisfying Hörmander's bracket condition.

hints.label: cor-instantaneous-smoothing-cinf
hints.title: Instantaneous Smoothing
hints.content:
886: :label: cor-instantaneous-smoothing-cinf
887: 
888: For any initial distribution μ_0 (possibly singular, e.g., δ_{w_0}), the time-evolved distribution μ_t = e^{tL} μ_0 has a C∞ density for all t > 0.

hints.label: prop-gaussian-tail-bounds-cinf
hints.title: Gaussian Tail Bounds (Conditional)
hints.content:
894: :label: prop-gaussian-tail-bounds-cinf
895: 
896: Under the confining potential hypothesis (lim U = +∞), the transition density satisfies:
897: 
898: $$
899: p_t(w, w') \leq C_t \cdot \exp\left(-\frac{d(w, w')^2}{D t}\right)
900: $$
901: 
902: for constants C_t, D > 0, where d(w, w') is the hypoelliptic distance.
